conditions: School must be a public school
Use grades from EPS to determine grades served for schools
action: Retrieve grade levels offered by the school from EPS.
outcome: Grade levels served by the school (e.g., PK–12).

conditions: School is Category 4 or Category 8
Home school OR serving school enrollment >= 10
Exceptions: Bismarck-Henning-Rossville-Alvin Cooperative HS and Paris Cooperative HS always receive a report card
When home enrollment < 10 AND serving enrollment >= 10, entity must NOT be a '3000' (special school) or '9000' (ROE program) RCDTS code
School was open during the school year and enrolled students as a home school
University of Illinois and Illinois State University lab schools receive a report card
No other school-level entity receives a report card
action: Evaluate entity category, enrollment thresholds, and RCDTS codes to determine report card eligibility.
outcome: Binary flag: entity is eligible (Yes/No) to receive a Report Card.

conditions: Exclude students enrolled in 'Evaluation' and 'Birth to Three' grades
Student's home school must be Category 4 or 8
Includes Pre-K centers that are Category 4 as part of a district
Excludes Early Childhood Centers not part of a district
Responsible school = home school, except for Bismarck-Henning-Rossville-Alvin Cooperative HS and Paris Cooperative HS
Responsible district = parent district of the responsible school
Students enrolled in deactivated schools are counted at the school where they are being served
action: Assign each student to a responsible school and responsible district based on home/serving school and cooperative exceptions.
outcome: Each student has a designated responsible school and responsible district for all Report Card metrics.

data_required: SIS Migrant, Military, Private School flags
conditions: All Students = all enrolled in reporting unit
Gender and Race from SIS demographics or assessment correction records
504 = active 504 Accommodation record
IEP = enrolled Oct 1 at serving school, in Dec 1 Child Count, not Fund Codes L/P/N/U
CWD = IEP and/or 504
Former CWD = had 504/IEP in past 4 years but not current
EL = current EL or currently EL-Transition Incomplete
Low Income from latest SIS demographic
Homeless = enrollment in SIS homeless table during year
Youth In Care from DCFS file
action: Classify each student into one or more demographic/program groups based on SIS data, snapshots, and external files.
outcome: Student group flags assigned: All Students, Gender, Race, 504, IEP, CWD, Former CWD, EL, Former EL, Never EL, Low Income, Homeless, Migrant, Youth In Care, Military, Private School.

outgoing_routes.condition: Student groups assigned for assessment metrics
Student groups assigned for enrollment metrics

data_required: Default grade range from School/District Type
conditions: Redaction applies to Ed. Preview, Report Card, and Public Data Set but NOT to DRVT
If denominator is 0 or missing, display 'No Data Available'
For non-accountability metrics: if count <= 9, redact
For count metrics (not numerator of percentage): display '*' (PDS) or 'Redacted' (IIRC) if count 1–9; blank/No Data if 0
For percentage metrics: display '*' or 'Redacted' if numerator < 10 and denominator exists
For IAR, SAT, DLM, ISA proficiency rates: redact based on denominator only
For Summative Designation components: redact if denominator < 20
No redaction at State level
No redaction for Teacher, Administrator, or Financial metrics (except per-pupil expenditure)
No redaction for External Data Collection metrics
If entity default grade range does not meet metric grade requirement: display only if not redacted (>= 10 students)
action: Apply redaction rules to each calculated metric value based on entity type, metric type, numerator/denominator thresholds.
outcome: Each metric value is either displayed, shown as 'Redacted'/'*', or shown as 'No Data Available'.

rule_name: Proficiency Rate – All Tests (ELA, Math, Science)
data_required: First Year in U.S. School indicator
conditions: High School (Grades 9–12): Use SAT and DLM-AA for ELA/Math (Levels 3 and 4 proficient, Grade 11–12 only); Use ISA and DLM-AA for Science (ISA Grade 11 only; DLM-AA Grade 11–12)
Elementary (Grades 3–8): Use IAR and DLM-AA for ELA/Math (IAR Levels 4–5, DLM-AA Levels 3–4); Use ISA and DLM-AA for Science (Grades 5, 8)
First Year in U.S. + EL = Yes: exclude from numerator and denominator
Exclude invalid records and suppressed content areas
For multiple valid records with same enrollment: use lesser scoreID (earliest test date)
Federal 95% Rule: if participation rate < 95%, use 95% of participation denominator as alternate denominator
action: Calculate proficiency rate: (Number proficient) ÷ (Number with valid scores excluding suppressed) × 100. Also calculate Federal 95% Rule proficiency rate when applicable.
outcome: Proficiency rate (%) for ELA, Math, and Science across all tests at school, district, and state level, disaggregated by student groups and grade.

data_required: First Year in U.S. School indicator
conditions: Levels 3 and 4 are proficient
Grades 3–8 and 11–12 for ELA and Math; Grades 5, 8, 11–12 for Science
Exclude Grades 9 and 10
Grade 12 students with valid score reported with Grade 11
First Year in U.S. + EL = Yes: exclude from numerator and denominator
No given scale scores, only performance levels
Exclude invalid records
action: Calculate proficiency rate: (Students at Level 3 or 4) ÷ (Students with valid scores excluding suppressed) × 100.
outcome: DLM-AA proficiency rate (%) for ELA, Math, and Science, disaggregated by student groups.

data_required: First Year in U.S. School indicator
conditions: Levels 3 and 4 are proficient
Grades 11 and 12 only (exclude Grades 9, 10)
First Year in U.S. + EL = Yes: exclude
Suppression 01 + RNVTA 22: exclude ELA and Math
Suppression 02 + RNVTA 19: exclude ELA, include Math
Suppression 03 + RNVTA 19: exclude Math, include ELA
action: Calculate proficiency rate and average SAT score for ELA and Math separately. Average Score = sum(valid scores) ÷ count(valid scores). Composite average includes only students with both unsuppressed ELA and Math.
outcome: SAT proficiency rate (%) and average score for ELA, Math, and Composite.

data_required: First Year in U.S. School indicator
conditions: Levels 3 (Proficient) and 4 (Exemplary) are proficient
Grades 5, 8, and 11 only
Student not flagged as taking DLM in SIS
First Year in U.S. + EL = Yes: exclude
Exclude invalid records
action: Calculate proficiency rate: (Students at Level 3 or 4) ÷ (Students with valid scores) × 100.
outcome: ISA Science proficiency rate (%) for Grades 5, 8, 11 disaggregated by student groups.

rule_name: Proficiency Rate and Student Growth Percentile – IAR (ELA and Math)
data_required: Individual Student Growth Percentiles (SGP) from vendor file
First Year in U.S. School indicator
conditions: Levels 4 and 5 are proficient
Grades 3–8
First Year in U.S. + EL = Yes: exclude from proficiency
SGP requires current and prior year test in same subject in standard progression (e.g., Grade 3→4)
Both cohort and baseline SGP displayed starting 2023
SGP disaggregated by Race, IEP, EL, Low Income, and proficiency levels
action: Calculate proficiency rate: (Students at Level 4 or 5) ÷ (Students with valid scores excluding suppressed) × 100. Calculate SGP: mean of individual SGPs at entity level.
outcome: IAR proficiency rate (%) and average Student Growth Percentile for ELA and Math, disaggregated by student groups.

rule_name: Participation Rate and No Participation Rate – All Tests (ELA, Math, Science)
data_required: First Year in U.S. School indicator
conditions: First Year in U.S. + EL = Yes with score: include in numerator and denominator
First Year in U.S. + EL = Yes without score: include in denominator only
SAT Suppression 01 + RNVTA 22: exclude from numerator and denominator
SAT Suppression 02: include in Math numerator/denominator; include in ELA denominator only
SAT Suppression 03: include in ELA numerator/denominator; include in Math denominator only
No score and no RNVTA: include in denominator only
ELA: Grades 3–8 (IAR/DLM-AA), Grade 11–12 (SAT/DLM-AA)
Math: Grades 3–8 (IAR/DLM-AA), Grade 11–12 (SAT/DLM-AA)
Science: Grades 5, 8, 11 (ISA/DLM-AA)
action: Participation Rate = (Students with Y in Participation Numerator) ÷ (Students with Y in Participation Denominator) × 100. No Participation Rate = (Students with N in Numerator) ÷ (Students with Y in Denominator) × 100.
outcome: Participation rate (%) and No Participation rate (%) for each subject and test type at school, district, state.

conditions: NAEP published every 2 years (2017, 2019, 2022, 2024)
Data can lag up to 2 years
For 2024 Report Card, display 2022 NAEP data
Reported at State and District level only, NOT school level
No data file provided – ISBE enters manually
action: Display NAEP reading and math results at state and district level. No ISBE calculations performed.
outcome: NAEP reading and math scores and inclusion rates displayed on Report Card.

conditions: 14 indicators: Graduation (1), Dropout (2), Statewide Assessment (3), Suspension/Expulsion (4A/4B), Education Environment K–21 (5A/5B/5C), Education Environment Preschool (6A/6B/6C), Preschool Outcomes (7A/7B/7C), Parent Involvement (8), Disproportionate Representation – Overall (9), Disproportionate Representation – Disability Categories (10), Evaluation Timelines (11), Part C to Part B Transition (12), Secondary Transition (13), Post-School Outcomes (14A/14B/14C)
District value compared to state target: Met = district >= target
4A/4B: Significant discrepancy = district rate > state rate + 1 SD for 3 consecutive years AND >= 5 IEP students suspended/expelled > 10 days
9/10: Disproportionality = weighted risk ratio >= 3.0 for 3 consecutive years with >= 10 students in group
action: For each indicator, compare district metric to state target/standard. Determine 'District Met State Target' (YES/NO/N/A).
outcome: SPP Indicator status (Met/Not Met/N/A) for each of the 14 indicators at district level.

conditions: Student is in 8th grade
Student has enrollment beginning on or before Oct 1 and ending after May 1
Sum of enrollment days > 212

Numerator: 8th grader assigned to an Algebra I prerequisite course (Algebra II, Geometry, Pre-Calculus, etc.) OR passed Algebra I equivalent course in final term (grades A+ through P = passing; F, U, I, W, etc. = not passing)
All courses during 8th grade year including summer sessions are included
Private school students excluded
action: Calculate rate: (8th graders who passed Algebra I or equivalent or are enrolled in a course requiring Algebra I) ÷ (Total qualified 8th grade students) × 100.
outcome: Percentage of 8th graders passing Algebra I at school, district, state.

data_required: SIS current and prior year enrollment (fall)
conditions: First-time 9th graders only: not enrolled in Grade 9+ in any past snapshot
Enrolled in Grade 9 on Oct 1 and May 1 of current year
Total enrollment days > 212; sum of enrollment days × PDA > 212 × 0.75
Exclude summer school enrollments (June 1+) and private school students
On track = passed courses totaling >= 5 credits AND failed core courses totaling <= 0.5 credits
Core subjects: ELA (01), Math (02), Science (03), Social Studies (04)
Completed courses: Full-year, S1/S2, T1/T2/T3, Q1/Q2/Q3/Q4
action: Calculate rate: (Students passing >= 5 credits without failing > 0.5 credits in core) ÷ (Total qualified first-time 9th graders) × 100.
outcome: 9th Grade on Track rate (%) at school, district, state.

conditions: CTE Participant: Grade 9–12 student completing at least one CTE course (Pass or Fail) in a single program
CTE Concentrator: passed 2+ Group 2/3/4/5 CTE courses in a single program during HS career
Exiting CTE Concentrator: concentrator who exited school with qualifying exit code
Courses must be state-approved, EFE-assigned
Summer courses counted in prior spring's school year
Perkins Measures: 0S1/0S2 counts, 1S1/1S2 graduation rates, 2S1/2S2/2S3 proficiency rates, 3S1 postsecondary placement, 4S1 nontraditional enrollment, 5S2/5S3 program quality
action: Count CTE participants, concentrators, and exiting concentrators. Calculate Perkins measures (graduation rates, proficiency rates, postsecondary placement, nontraditional enrollment, dual credit/work-based learning). Aggregate by cluster and program.
outcome: CTE enrollment counts, participant/concentrator/exiting counts by cluster; Perkins performance measures at school, district, state.

data_required: AI Code to RCDTS cross-reference table
conditions: Data provided by College Board flat file – not matched to SIS
Grades 9, 10, 11, 12 reported; all others excluded
A score of 3+ earns college credit at Illinois public institutions
Exam counts accumulate across student's career, listed under last grade tested
action: Calculate four metrics: Students Taking 1+ AP Exams (distinct count by grade), Students Eligible for College Credit on 1+ AP Exams (score >= 3), Total AP Exams Taken (career count), Total AP Exams Eligible for College Credit.
outcome: AP exam participation and passing counts by grade at school level.

conditions: Use graduates from 2 years prior to Report Card year
Enrolled within 12 months = enrollment on or before Sept 30 of following year
Enrolled within 16 months = enrollment on or before Jan 31 two years after graduation
Exclude NSC status: A (Leave of Absence), W (Withdrawn), D (Deceased)
Exclude duplicate enrollments (same college, same month); keep latest end date
Exclude enrollments < 30 calendar days
Exclude enrollment begin date prior to graduation (dual enrollment)
First post-graduation enrollment is evaluated for timeframe
action: Calculate 12-month and 16-month postsecondary enrollment rates: (Graduates enrolled in college within timeframe) ÷ (Total graduates) × 100.
outcome: Postsecondary enrollment rate (%) at 12 and 16 months, by institution type (2-year, 4-year, trade) and sector (public, private).

data_required: Illinois Community College Board (ICCB) student file
Illinois Board of Higher Education (IBHE) student file
conditions: Community College: ICCB data matched to graduating class from prior year; remedial credit >= 0.5 in Math, Reading, or Communications
Postsecondary (4-year): IBHE data matched to graduating class; remedial enrollment in Math or ELA
Only high school graduates included
Overall = remedial credit in any subject
action: Community College Remediation = (Students with >= 0.5 remedial credit) ÷ (Students attending ICCB institution) × 100. Postsecondary Remediation = (Students enrolled in remedial courses) ÷ (Students attending IBHE institution) × 100. Repeat per subject.
outcome: Community College and Postsecondary remediation rates (%) overall and by subject.

data_required: SIS IDEA Services (IEP) and 504 Plan records
conditions: 4-year cohort: reporting year − 3 = 9th grade entry year
5-year cohort: reporting year − 4
6-year cohort: reporting year − 5
Graduate = exit code 06 (Graduated)
Excluded from cohort: exit 03 (Home Schooled), 04 (Private School), 07 (Death), 18 (Moved out of US), 19/20 (Transfer out of Illinois)
Students not counted at more than one school/district
Exclude private school students
CWD, EL, Homeless, YIC = ever-had during HS career
action: Graduation Rate = (Graduates) ÷ (Graduates + Non-Graduates) × 100. Non-Graduates = all students not coded 06 and not excluded.
outcome: 4-year, 5-year, and 6-year adjusted cohort graduation rates (%) and student counts at school, district, state.

data_required: Cut scores for readiness by developmental area
conditions: Districts with students in Categories 2, 4, 8
Teachers rate on 14 required measures in first 40 days of enrollment
Three developmental areas: Social/Emotional, Language/Literacy, Math
Participation denominator: distinct kindergarten students with longest enrollment >= 30 days through Nov 1
Students with valid scores and ANY matching enrollment included regardless of length
Exclude private school (PSS indicator) students
Exclude RNVTA codes 01–09, 35, 40 from participation
District and State level only – no school level
action: Calculate participation rate, readiness rates (0, 1, 2, 3 areas), and readiness per developmental area. Each = (numerator) ÷ (denominator) × 100, rounded to nearest whole percent.
outcome: KIDS participation rate (%) and kindergarten readiness rates (%) by developmental area at district and state, disaggregated by student groups.

conditions: Exclude students with code 3 (cognitively unable, IEP/504/EL) or code 4 (transferred out)
School over 50% = both student AND teacher response rates > 50%
School counted only if both rates present
5Essentials components: Effective Leaders, Collaborative Teachers, Supportive Environment, Ambitious Instruction, Involved Families
Component scores: 1 (Very Weak, 1–19), 2 (Weak, 20–39), 3 (Neutral, 40–59), 4 (Strong, 60–79), 5 (Very Strong, 80+), 0 (N/A or Low Response)
Cognia and CSCI: response rates only (no component data collected)
action: Calculate student and teacher response rates. District % schools over 50% = (schools with both rates > 50%) ÷ (eligible schools). Display 5Essentials component levels at school.
outcome: Climate survey response rates and 5Essentials component ratings at school; district-level % of schools over 50%.

conditions: Administered biennially (e.g., 2020, 2022, 2024) in spring
Grades 8, 10, 12 (other grades may be offered)
Participation not required
Participating = at least 10 valid surveys in at least one grade
action: Display whether school participated in IYS (Yes/No). Data alignment: Report Card year = IYS data year (every 2 years).
outcome: Binary participation indicator (Yes/No) for school.

data_required: AFR spreadsheet from School Business Services
conditions: District must submit audited AFR
Values are district-reported, passed through (no Data Warehouse calculations)
EAV and Tax Rate use Report Card year − 3 tax year
Instructional/Operating per pupil use prior fiscal year
action: Display district dollar amounts and percentages. Expenditure by Function = category ÷ total expenditures. Revenue by Source = category ÷ total revenue. Per-pupil = expenditure ÷ 9-month ADA.
outcome: Financial metrics at district and state: Expenditure by function (%), Revenue by source ($ and %), EAV per pupil, Tax rate per $100, Instructional and Operating expenditure per pupil.

data_required: EBF calculation spreadsheets from State Funding and Forecasting
conditions: District-level only (no school or state reporting)
Report Card uses EBF from fiscal year matching school year
action: Pull and display EBF Tier, Adequacy Target, % Adequacy, Local Capacity Target, Real Receipts, Final Resources. Derive: Local Capacity %, Real Receipts/Adequacy Target, Real Receipts as % of Local Capacity Target.
outcome: EBF tier and adequacy metrics displayed at district level.

data_required: Enrollment dates and PDA (Percent Day Attendance)
conditions: PreK–12; exclude Private School, Evaluation, Birth to Three
Active enrollment on Oct 1
FEEnrollment logic for 50/50 split
Category 9 at home school/district
Enrollment is based on serving school (not home school)
action: Count distinct students by entity. Calculate total enrollment and disaggregated counts/percentages by grade and demographic group. Percent = (group count ÷ entity enrollment) × 100.
outcome: Total enrollment and disaggregated counts/percentages (race, gender, EL, IEP, Low Income, Homeless) at school, district, state.

data_required: ACCESS composite score, domain scores, and performance levels
First EL date for long-term EL determination
conditions: Student is EL until ACCESS composite >= 4.8
K–12 only (exclude Pre-K from counts)
Long-term EL: > 7 years as EL and not yet proficient
Transition and outcome status by exit codes
CPS vs non-CPS logic for transition/outcome
action: Calculate EL counts and percentages, exit count/rate, ACCESS participation rate, performance level distribution, long-term EL count, transition and outcome status.
outcome: EL count/%, exit rate, ACCESS participation and performance, long-term EL, transition/outcome at school, district, state.

conditions: One accelerated/gifted record per student per district per year
Use last entry if multiple
Count at responsible school of year-end enrollment
AP: any student enrolled in AP course per course catalog
Dual-credit: college credit earned in a dual-credit course
Gifted: codes 01=assessed only, 02=identified, 03=assessed+taught by endorsed teacher, 04=identified+taught by endorsed teacher, 05=assessed and identified
action: Count and calculate percentages for each category: Accelerated (by type), AP coursework, IB coursework, Enriched/Honors, Dual-Credit, Gifted (assessed, identified, taught by endorsed teacher).
outcome: Advanced academic program counts and percentages at school, district, state.

data_required: SIS IDEA Services (IEP) and 504 Plan records
conditions: IEP: enrolled Oct 1, in Dec 1 Child Count, not fund L/N/P/U
Education Environment groups: Early Childhood and School Age
Denominators: total in EE group; also by race/disability
No school-level reporting
Peer comparison: State, Peer District, District
action: Calculate IEP distribution by race and disability (%). Calculate education environment percentages overall and by race/disability.
outcome: IEP by race/disability distribution and education environment percentages at district and state with peer comparison.

rule_name: Student Attendance Rate and Chronic Absenteeism
data_required: Enrollment dates and PDA (Percent Day Attendance)
conditions: Total Days from school calendar
Attendance Rate: K–12; days present vs non-attendance; exclude private
Chronic Truancy: Grades 1–12; unexcused absences >= 5% of attendance days; enrollment threshold 21 days
Chronic Absenteeism: K–12; total absences >= 10% of attendance days; exclude Hospitalized/Medically Homebound; 11+ consecutive days; enrollment threshold 10 days
Truancy: Grades 1–12; unexcused > 1% and < 5%
Multiple enrollments: sum days and absences across enrollments
action: Calculate Total School Days, Student Attendance Rate = (Days Present) ÷ (Total Attendance Days) × 100. Chronic Truancy Rate = (Students with >= 5% unexcused) ÷ (All eligible students) × 100. Chronic Absentee Rate = (Students with >= 10% total absences) ÷ (All eligible students) × 100.
outcome: Total school days, student attendance rate (%), chronic truancy rate (%), chronic absentee rate (%), truancy rate (%) at school, district, state.

conditions: Exclude students who exited with graduation (Code 06) or certificate of completion (Code 15)
Mobile = transferred out (exited after Oct 1 before May 1) or transferred in (enrolled after Oct 1 before May 1)
Each student counted once per entity per year
Exclude private school students
action: Mobility Rate = (Unduplicated mobile students) ÷ (Unduplicated students enrolled Oct 1–May 1 excluding exits 06/15) × 100.
outcome: Student mobility rate (%) at school, district, state.

data_required: Fall Enrollment and End of Year snapshots
conditions: Include students whose last regular enrollment was Grade 9+
Exclude summer school and private school
Dropout = exit code 09 (Dropped Out), 10 (Transfer to GED), 11 (Moved not known continuing)
Prior year cohort not enrolled: no enrollment in reporting year AND prior year exit was 05 (Promotion), 12 (Retained), 17 (Change in Serving/FTE), or 08 (Expulsion)
action: Dropout Rate = (Dropout students + Prior year cohort not enrolled) ÷ (All students for reporting year + Prior year cohort not enrolled) × 100.
outcome: Dropout rate (%) at school, district, state.

data_required: SIS IDEA Services (IEP) and 504 Plan records
conditions: Include per 105 ILCS 5/2-3.162: violence resulting in OSS, expulsion, removals to alternate settings
Actions: 01 Expulsion-Received Services, 02 Expulsion-Did Not Receive, 03 In-School Suspension, 04 Out-of-School Suspension, 05/06/07 Removals
Count by serving school for school year
YEC indicator = 1 when school reported discipline in YEC but has no SIS discipline of that type
action: Count distinct students with discipline and total incidents by action code. Disaggregate by discipline action, gender, race, grade band (K–8, 9–12), program (EL, FRL, IEP), incident type, and duration buckets.
outcome: Discipline counts and rates at school, district, state, disaggregated by demographics and incident type.

rule_name: Health Minutes and Truant Minor Count
conditions: Data is self-reported by schools/district
School year from YEC same as Report Card year
Public School (Category 4) and State-funded School (Category 8) only
Kindergarten through Grade 12 only
District = parent district of the public school
action: School = Count Average Days of PE Per Week Per Student. District = (Total Average PE Days / Distinct Schools) × 100. State = (Total Average PE Days / Distinct Schools in State) × 100. Truant Minor Count = count at school, district; state = total across state.
outcome: Health and Wellness count and Truant Minor Count at school, district, state.

rule_name: Summative Designation – CCRI Meta Indicator Components
data_required: SIS Graduated students (exit code 06) at home school
conditions: Denominator = graduates from applicable year at home school
95% Attendance: combined JR/SR year = (Days Present + Detention) / (Days Present + Detention + Days Unexcused)
GPA ranges: 3.75+, 2.8–3.74, below 2.8
College-ready SAT/ACT minimum: ACT 30+ or SAT 1400+
Academic ELA indicator: AP/IB/dual credit/Transitional English/ACT-SAT ELA pass, etc.
Academic Math indicator: AP/IB/dual credit/Transitional Math/Algebra II/ACT-SAT Math pass, etc.
Career Area of Interest by sophomore year

Career-ready indicators: Career Development Experience, Industry Credential, Military/ASVAB>=31, Dual Credit Career Pathway, Program of Study, 12+ months employment, 25+ hrs community service, 2+ co-curricular activities
Grades A/B/C or commensurate and >= 1.0 credit where specified
action: For each CCRI component: (Graduates meeting requirement) ÷ (Total graduates) × 100.
outcome: Percentage of graduates meeting each CCRI component (attendance, GPA, SAT/ACT minimum, Academic ELA, Academic Math, Career Area, Career Ready count, Pathway Endorsement).

rule_name: Summative Designation – Fine Arts Meta Indicator Components
data_required: SIS course enrollments (fine arts course codes)
Teacher EIN and License/Endorsement codes (Arts, Music)
conditions: Student Participation: non-duplicated count of students in 1+ fine arts courses (all grades including K)
Teacher Qualifications: students in arts courses taught by qualified IL teacher with specified endorsement codes (DA, THDR, VARS, MUAP, BAND, etc.)
action: Student Participation = (Students in 1+ fine arts course) ÷ (Total students at school) × 100. Teacher Qualifications = (Students in arts course taught by qualified teacher) ÷ (Students in 1+ arts course) × 100.
outcome: Fine arts student participation (%) and qualified teacher rate (%).

rule_name: Summative Designation – P-2 Meta Indicator Components
conditions: Chronic Absenteeism: % of K, 1, 2 students who are chronically absent
Dual Language: % of Current EL or Transition Incomplete in K, 1, 2 enrolled in dual language programs
3rd Grade Literacy: % of 3rd graders receiving A, B, or C (or commensurate standards) in ELA
action: Calculate each P-2 component percentage using the applicable grade/student subset and criteria.
outcome: P-2 meta indicator component percentages (chronic absenteeism, dual language, 3rd grade literacy).

rule_name: Summative Designation – Elementary/Middle Meta Indicator Components
data_required: 6th–8th grade course grades in core content
conditions: 5th Grade Math: % of 5th graders with A, B, or C in math
Middle School Academic Success: % of Grades 6–8 with at least one A or B and no D or F in core content
Middle School Discipline: % of Grades 6–8 with suspension or expulsion in current year
action: Calculate each Elementary/Middle component percentage using the applicable grade/student subset.
outcome: Elementary/Middle meta indicator component percentages (5th grade math, middle school success, middle school discipline).

data_required: School improvement status from prior year
conditions: Schools identified for improvement based on Summative Designation results
Improvement status may carry over from prior years ('in arrears')
Grant amounts displayed alongside improvement status
action: Determine school improvement status based on Summative Designation and carry-over logic. Display associated grant amounts.
outcome: School improvement status (Comprehensive, Targeted, Additional Targeted, or None) and associated grant amounts.

conditions: If school received Title I allocation in prior school year (amount > $0), school is Title I
Status subtypes: Title I Targeted, Title I Schoolwide, Title I Eligible but Not Served, Title I Ineligible Due to Ranking
action: Look up prior year Title I allocation from eGMS. If > $0, entity is Title I.
outcome: Title I status (Yes/No) and subtype for the school.

data_required: SIS IDEA Services (IEP) and 504 Plan records
conditions: Include core courses only (ELA, Math, Science, Social Studies, PE, Arts, World Languages)
Exclude: special ed sections (> 30% IEP), Biblical Literature, certain HS course titles, sections with 0–1 students
Exclude: HS sections > 50 students, Elementary sections > 40 students
Exclude summer sessions and Erroneous outcome codes
action: Average Class Size = Sum(section enrollments) ÷ Sum(number of sections).
outcome: Average class size (and by grade level where applicable) at school, district, state.

data_required: SBER system: per-pupil site-level and centralized expenditures
conditions: SBER enrollment: PK–12 spanning Oct 1 or Mar 1
All enrollments contribute FTE
Redact if enrollment < 10
District in EPS Category 2 with FTE > 0 must report
action: Display SBER per-pupil amounts, district average and variance, total LEA expenditures. PreK callout as combined weighted average.
outcome: Per-pupil expenditures by school/site, district average, total expenditures, enrollment FTE with optional narratives.

data_required: SIS current and prior year enrollment (fall)
conditions: Valid enrollment both years
Prior grade = max grade at prior school
Current grade = min grade at current school
Prior grade at least one behind current
Only grades with >= 15 feeder enrollments
action: Feeder % = (Receiving School Enrollment by Feeder ÷ Feeder School Enrollment) × 100. If >= 50%, prior year school is feeder for current year school.
outcome: Feeder school flag (Yes/No) and percentage for each receiving school.

conditions: Teacher = staff member with EIS role coded as teacher
FTE from EIS employment records
Retention: teachers employed at same school/district both years
Novice teacher: 0–3 years experience
Evaluation: rated Proficient or Excellent per IL evaluation framework
No redaction rules for teacher metrics
action: Calculate: Teacher Retention Rate, FTE Count, Headcount, Gender/Race Distribution, Education Distribution (Bachelor's, Master's+), Average IL Experience, Novice Ratio, Average Salary, Attendance Rate, Evaluation Ratings, Pupil-Teacher Ratio (Elementary and HS), Short-Term/Provisional License Count.
outcome: Teacher measure values at school, district, state: retention, FTE, demographics, education, experience, salary, attendance, evaluation, pupil-teacher ratio.

data_required: National Board for Professional Teaching Standards (NBPTS) certification list
conditions: Teacher holds current National Board certification
Matched to school employment records
action: Count of National Board Certified Teachers at each school/district/state. Disaggregate by demographics.
outcome: National Board Certified Teacher count and demographics.

data_required: Teacher EIN and License/Endorsement codes (Arts, Music)
conditions: In-field: teacher's endorsement matches the subject area of the course taught
Out-of-field: teacher's endorsement does NOT match subject area
Determined at the course-assignment level
action: For each teacher-course assignment, compare endorsement to required subject area. Calculate in-field and out-of-field rates.
outcome: In-field and out-of-field teacher rates at school, district, state.

data_required: EIS administrator and support staff employment records
conditions: Administrator = staff with principal/assistant principal role
Support Personnel = staff with qualifying support role codes
Certified Staff FTE per specific EIS role definitions
Principal turnover: different principal EIN from prior year
action: Calculate: Administrator FTE, Administrator-to-Student Ratio, Principal Turnover, Support Staff FTE, Support Staff demographics and salary.
outcome: Administrator and support personnel metrics at school, district, state.

data_required: CRDC data from U.S. Department of Education Office for Civil Rights (OCR)
conditions: Data from CRDC collection (currently displaying 2020-21 data as 2021-22 not yet released by OCR)
School-level and district-level
Year reference updated when new CRDC data becomes available
action: Display CRDC data elements: suspension rates (in-school, out-of-school), expulsion rates, school-related arrests, referrals to law enforcement, chronic absenteeism, harassment/bullying, by race/gender/disability.
outcome: CRDC metrics displayed at school and district level.

conditions: Legislative district assignment from EPS records
action: Retrieve and display senate and house legislative district identifiers for each school and district.
